articles.author: Kylie Madry, Valentine Hilaire
articles.description: Claudia Sheinbaum, a Nobel Prize-winning climate scientist, will become Mexico's first female president after winning a landslide election victory and promising to continue the work of her mentor and outgoing leader Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador.
articles.title: Claudia Sheinbaum claims sweeping mandate to become Mexico's first female president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said on Monday there was no place for threats of violence or instability after last week's election cost his African National Congress (ANC) party its majority for the first time.
articles.title: South Africa's Ramaphosa says violence has no place after election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Georgia's parliamentary speaker signed into law on Monday a bill on "foreign agents" that has caused a political crisis in the South Caucasus country and drawn sharp criticism from its Western allies.
articles.title: Georgian parliamentary speaker signs 'foreign agents' bill into law

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said on Monday the United States could face "fatal consequences" if it ignored Moscow's warnings not to let Ukraine use weapons provided by Washington to strike targets inside Russia.
articles.title: Russia warns US against 'fatal' miscalculation in Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A court in Pakistan has overturned the prison sentence of jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan on Monday in a case pertaining to the leaking of state secrets, local broadcaster ARY news and his lawyer said.
articles.title: Pakistan court suspends former PM Imran Khan's sentence in state secrets case - ARY News

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea plans to suspend a military agreement signed with North Korea in 2018 aimed at easing tensions, the presidential office said on Monday, after Seoul warned of a strong response to balloons launched by Pyongyang carrying trash to the South.
articles.title: South Korea to suspend military pact with North over trash balloons

articles.author: Rajesh Prabhuswamy, Sakshi Dayal
articles.description: India's Election Commission said on Monday a record-breaking 642 million voters cast their ballots in the general election that concluded on June 1 and dismissed opposition concerns over how the votes would be counted.
articles.title: Indian election commission bats away concerns in record-breaking ballot count

articles.author: David Alire Garcia
articles.description: Claudia Sheinbaum basked in the glow of a thumping presidential win late Sunday, thanking supporters who gathered at the capital's iconic Zocalo plaza shortly after 1 a.m. to applaud Mexico's first female president.
articles.title: Mexico's Sheinbaum blazes trail as first woman president, under mentor's watchful eye

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The British government says it intends to begin deporting asylum seekers on July 23, court documents showed on Monday, although the controversial scheme is dependent on Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's Conservative parties winning the upcoming election.
articles.title: UK says Rwanda asylum seekers' deportation flights to begin on July 23

articles.author: Julia Payne
articles.description: The European Union's disinformation-busting team last month debunked a Russian-language video on YouTube that said citizens were fleeing dictatorship in EU member Poland and seeking refuge in Belarus, a close ally of Moscow.
articles.title: European election: EU struggles to counter Russian disinformation
